summary.long: Exodus is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: Now these are the names of the sons of Israel, which came into Egypt (each man and his household came with Jacob):
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dan, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people who came from the seed of Jacob were seventy people, but Joseph was in Egypt already.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph died, as did all his brothers, and all that generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, the sons of Israel were fruitful, and increased abundantly, and multiplied, and became exceedingly mighty, so that the land was filled with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there rose up a new king over Egypt, who did not know Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to his people, “Surely, the people of the sons of Israel are more numerous and powerful than we.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come, let us deal wisely with them, lest they multiply, and it come to pass that when any war breaks out, they also join our enemies, and fight against us, and escape from the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore they set taskmasters over them to afflict them with their labor. They built for Pharaoh storage cities: Pithom and Rameses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the more they afflicted them, the more they multiplied and grew so that as a result they abhorred the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Egyptians made the children of Israel to serve with rigor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they made their lives bitter with hard service—in mortar and in brick, and in all manner of service in the field, all their service in which they made them serve was with rigor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king of Egypt spoke to the Hebrew midwives, of which the name of one was Shiphrah, and the name of the other Puah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said, “When you perform the office of a midwife to the Hebrew women and see them on the stools, if it is a son, then you must kill him, but if it is a daughter, then she may live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, the midwives feared God, and did not do as the king of Egypt commanded them, but kept the male children alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king of Egypt called for the midwives and said to them, “Why have you done this thing and preserved the male children’s lives?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The midwives said to Pharaoh, “Because the Hebrew women are not like the Egyptian women, for they are vigorous and give birth before the midwives come to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore God dealt well with the midwives, and the people multiplied and grew very mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it happened that because the midwives feared God, He gave them families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh charged all his people, saying, “You must cast every son that is born into the river, and you must preserve every daughter’s life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a man of the house of Levi went and married a daughter of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the woman conceived and bore a son, and when she saw him, that he was a beautiful child, she hid him three months.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she could no longer hide him, she took for him a container made of bulrushes and daubed it with tar and with pitch. She then put the child in it and set it in the reeds by the river’s bank.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his sister stood afar off so that she might know what would happen to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The daughter of Pharaoh came down to wash herself at the river while her maidens walked along by the river’s side, and when she saw the container among the reeds, she sent her maid, and she retrieved it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she opened it, she saw the child. He was crying. She had compassion on him and said, “This is one of the Hebrews’ children.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his sister said to Pharaoh’s daughter, “Shall I go and call for you a nursing woman of the Hebrew women so that she may nurse the child for you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her, “Go.” So the young girl went and called the child’s mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh’s daughter said to her, “Take this child away, and nurse him for me, and I will give you your wages.” So the woman took the child and nursed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the child grew, and she brought him to Pharaoh’s daughter, and he became her son. And she called his name Moses and said, “Because I drew him out of the water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days, when Moses was grown, he went out to his brothers and looked on their burdens; and he saw an Egyptian striking a Hebrew, one of his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He looked this way and that way, and when he saw no one, he killed the Egyptian and hid him in the sand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he went out the next day, two men of the Hebrews struggled with each other; and he said to him that did the wrong, “Why do you strike your companion?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Who made you a prince and a judge over us? Do you intend to kill me as you killed the Egyptian?” Moses feared and said, “Surely this thing is known.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Pharaoh heard this thing, he sought to slay Moses. But Moses fled from the presence of Pharaoh and settled in the land of Midian, and he dwelled by a well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the priest of Midian had seven daughters, and they came and drew water, and filled the troughs to water their father’s flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shepherds came and drove them away, but Moses stood up and helped them, and watered their flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to Reuel their father, he said, “Why is it you have come back so soon today?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “An Egyptian delivered us out of the hand of the shepherds and also drew water for us and watered the flock.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to his daughters, “So where is he? Why is it that you have left the man? Call him so that he may eat bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses was content to dwell with the man, and he gave Zipporah, his daughter, to Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she gave birth to a son, and he called his name Gershom, for he said, “I have been a sojourner in a foreign land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the passing of time the king of Egypt died. And the children of Israel sighed because of the bondage, and they cried out, and their cry came up to God on account of the bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God heard their groaning, and God remembered His covenant with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God looked on the children of Israel, and God had concern for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Moses kept the flock of Jethro his father-in-law, the priest of Midian, and he led the flock to the far side of the desert and came to the mountain of God, to Horeb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel of the Lord appeared to him in a flame of fire from the midst of a bush, and he looked, and the bush burned with fire, but the bush was not consumed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses said, “I will now turn aside and see this great sight, why the bush is not burnt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the Lord saw that he turned aside to see, God called to him from out of the midst of the bush and said, “Moses, Moses.”
And he said, “Here am I.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: He said, “Do not approach here. Remove your sandals from off your feet, for the place on which you are standing is holy ground.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: Moreover He said, “I am the God of your father, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.” And Moses hid his face, for he was afraid to look upon God.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: The Lord said, “I have surely seen the affliction of My people who are in Egypt and have heard their cry on account of their taskmasters, for I know their sorrows.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: Therefore, I have come down to deliver them out of the hand of the Egyptians, and to bring them up out of that land to a good and spacious land, to a land flowing with milk and honey, to the place of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: Now therefore, the cry of the children of Israel has come to Me. Moreover, I have also seen the oppression with which the Egyptians are oppressing them.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: Come now therefore, and I will send you to Pharaoh so that you may bring forth My people, the children of Israel, out of Egypt.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: Moses said to God, “Who am I that I should go to Pharaoh and that I should bring forth the children of Israel out of Egypt?”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And He said, “Certainly I will be with you, and this will be a sign to you, that I have sent you: When you have brought forth the people out of Egypt, all of you shall serve God on this mountain.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: Moses said to God, “I am going to the children of Israel and will say to them, ‘The God of your fathers has sent me to you.’ When they say to me, ‘What is His name?’ what shall I say to them?”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And God said to Moses, “I AM WHO I AM,” and He said, “You will say this to the children of Israel, ‘I AM has sent me to you.’ ”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: God, moreover, said to Moses, “Thus you will say to the children of Israel, ‘The Lord, the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, has sent me to you. This is My name forever, and this is My memorial to all generations.’
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: “Go, and gather the elders of Israel together, and say to them, ‘The Lord, the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Jacob, appeared to me, saying, “I am indeed concerned about you and what has been done to you in Egypt.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: Therefore, I said, I will bring you up out of the affliction of Egypt to the land of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, to a land flowing with milk and honey.” ’
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: “They shall listen to your voice, and you shall come, you and the elders of Israel, to the king of Egypt, and you must say to him, ‘The Lord, the God of the Hebrews has met with us. Therefore, now, let us go, we ask you, three days’ journey into the wilderness so that we may sacrifice to the Lord our God.’
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: However, I know that the king of Egypt will not let you go, no, not even under a forceful hand.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: So I will stretch out My hand and strike Egypt with all My wonders which I will perform in its midst, and after that he will let you go.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: “I will give this people favor in the sight of the Egyptians, and it will come to pass, that, when you go, you will not go empty-handed.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: But every woman will borrow of her neighbor, and of her that sojourns in her house, articles of silver, and articles of gold, and clothing, and you will put them on your sons, and on your daughters—in this way you will plunder the Egyptians.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And Moses answered and said, “But they will not believe me, nor listen to my voice. For they will say, ‘The Lord has not appeared to you.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord said to him, “What is that in your hand?”
And he said, “A rod.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said, “Throw it on the ground.”
And he threw it on the ground, and it became a serpent. Then Moses fled from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Put forth your hand and take it by the tail.” And he put forth his hand, and caught it, and it became a rod in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is so that they may believe that the Lord, the God of their fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, has appeared to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said furthermore to him, “Now put your hand into your bosom.” He put his hand into his bosom, and when he took it out, his hand was as leprous as snow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Put your hand into your bosom again.” So he put his hand into his bosom again and brought it out of his bosom, and it was restored like his other flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If they will not believe you, nor listen to the voice of the first sign, then they may believe the voice of the latter sign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they will not believe also these two signs or listen to your voice, then you shall take water from the river and pour it on the dry land, and the water which you take out of the river will become blood on the dry land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said to the Lord, “O my Lord, I am not eloquent, neither before nor since You have spoken to Your servant. But I am slow of speech, and of a slow tongue.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to him, “Who has made man’s mouth? Or who made the dumb, or deaf, or the seeing, or the blind? Have not I, the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore go, and I will be with your mouth and teach you what you must say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “O my Lord, send, I pray, by the hand of whomever else You will send.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The anger of the Lord was inflamed against Moses, and He said, “Is not Aaron the Levite your brother? I know that he can speak well. And also, he comes out to meet you, and when he sees you, he will be glad in his heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall speak to him and put the words in his mouth, and I will be with your mouth, and with his mouth, and will teach you what you must do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What’s more, he will be your spokesman to the people, and he will be as a mouth for you, and you will be as God to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must take this rod in your hand, with which you will perform the signs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moses went and returned to Jethro his father-in-law and said to him, “Please let me go and return to my brothers who are in Egypt, and see whether they be yet alive.”
And Jethro said to Moses, “Go in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses in Midian, “Go, return to Egypt, for all the men are dead who sought your life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses took his wife and his sons and set them on a donkey, and he returned to the land of Egypt. And Moses took the rod of God in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “When you go to return into Egypt, see that you do all those wonders before Pharaoh, which I have put in your hand, but I will harden his heart, so that he shall not let the people go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall say to Pharaoh, ‘Thus says the Lord: Israel is My son, even My firstborn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I say to you, “Let My son go, that he may serve Me. And if you refuse to let him go, I will slay your son, even your firstborn.” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At a lodging place on the way, the Lord met him and sought to kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zipporah took a sharp stone, and cut off the foreskin of her son, and threw it at his feet, and said, “Surely a bloody husband are you to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So He let him go. Then she said, “A bloody husband you are, because of the circumcision.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord said to Aaron, “Go into the wilderness to meet Moses.” So he went, and met him at the mount of God, and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses told Aaron all the words of the Lord who had sent him, and all the signs which He had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses and Aaron went and gathered together all the elders of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron spoke all the words which the Lord had spoken to Moses and did the signs in the sight of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people believed. And when they heard that the Lord had visited the children of Israel and that He had looked on their affliction, they bowed down and worshipped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And afterward Moses and Aaron went in and said to Pharaoh, “Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel, ‘Let My people go, that they may hold a feast to Me in the wilderness.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh said, “Who is the Lord that I should obey His voice to let Israel go? I do not know the Lord, nor will I let Israel go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “The God of the Hebrews has met with us. Let us go, we pray you, three days’ journey into the wilderness, and sacrifice to the Lord our God, lest He fall upon us with pestilence or with the sword.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the king of Egypt said to them, “Why do you, Moses and Aaron, take the people from their work? Get back to your labor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh said, “Look, the people of the land now are numerous, and you make them rest from their labor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh commanded the same day the taskmasters of the people and their officers, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall no more give the people straw to make brick, as before. Let them go and gather straw for themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, the quota of the bricks, which they were making previously, you shall lay upon them. You shall not diminish any of it. For they are idle. Therefore they cry out, saying, ‘Let us go and sacrifice to our God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let there be more work laid upon the men so that they may labor therein, and let them not regard deceptive words.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The taskmasters of the people and their officers went out, and they spoke to the people, saying, “Thus says Pharaoh, ‘I will not give you straw.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go, get straw where you can find it, yet nothing of your work shall be diminished.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people scattered abroad throughout all the land of Egypt to gather stubble for straw.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The taskmasters pushed them, saying, “Fulfill your works, your daily tasks, just as when there was straw.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The officers of the children of Israel, which Pharaoh’s taskmasters had set over them, were beaten and were asked, and demanded, “Why have you not fulfilled your task in making brick both yesterday and today, as previously?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the officers of the children of Israel came and cried to Pharaoh, saying, “Why do you deal this way with your servants?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is no straw being given to your servants, and they say to us, ‘Make brick.’ And indeed, your servants are beaten, but the fault is in your own people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “You are slackers! Slackers! Therefore you say, ‘Let us go and do sacrifice to the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go therefore now and work, for there shall no straw be given you, yet shall you deliver the quota of bricks.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The officers of the children of Israel saw that they were in trouble, after it was said, “You shall not diminish anything from your bricks of your daily task.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they met Moses and Aaron, who stood in the way, as they came forth from Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to them, “May the Lord look on you and judge, because you have made our scent stink in the estimation of Pharaoh and in the estimation of his servants, to put a sword in their hand to slay us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses returned to the Lord, and said, “Lord, why have You caused trouble for this people? Why is it that You have sent me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For since I came to Pharaoh to speak in Your name, he has done evil to this people; neither have You delivered Your people at all.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Now you shall see what I will do to Pharaoh, for with a strong hand shall he let them go, and with a strong hand shall he drive them out of his land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God spoke to Moses, and said to him, “I am the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I appeared to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, by the name of God Almighty, but by My name, The Lord, I was not known to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have also established My covenant with them, to give them the land of Canaan, the land of their pilgrimage, wherein they sojourned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have also heard the groaning of the children of Israel, whom the Egyptians keep in bondage, and I have remembered My covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore say to the children of Israel: ‘I am the Lord, and I will bring you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians, and I will rid you out of their bondage, and I will redeem you with a stretched-out arm and with great judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will take you to Me for a people, and I will be to you a God. And you shall know that I am the Lord your God, who brings you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring you into the land, which I swore to give to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, and I will give it to you for a heritage. I am the Lord.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses spoke so to the children of Israel, but they did not listen to Moses on account of their anguish of spirit and for cruel bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go in, tell Pharaoh king of Egypt to let the children of Israel go out of his land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses spoke before the Lord, saying, “The children of Israel have not listened to me. How then shall Pharaoh listen to me, as I am of uncircumcised lips?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses and to Aaron, and gave them a command for the children of Israel, and for Pharaoh, king of Egypt, to bring the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These are the heads of their fathers’ houses:
The sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel: Hanok, Pallu, Hezron, and Karmi. These are the families of Reuben.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Simeon: Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jakin, Zohar, and Shaul the son of a Canaanite woman. These are the families of Simeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the sons of Levi according to their generations: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari, and the years of the life of Levi were one hundred and thirty-seven years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Gershon: Libni, and Shimei, according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel, and the years of the life of Kohath were one hundred and thirty-three years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi.
These are the families of Levi according to their generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Amram married Jochebed his father’s sister, and she bore him Aaron and Moses. And the years of the life of Amram were one hundred and thirty-seven years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Izhar: Korah, Nepheg, and Zikri.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Uzziel: Mishael, Elzaphan, and Sithri.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron took to himself Elisheba, daughter of Amminadab, sister of Nahshon, to wife; and she bore him Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Korah: Assir, Elkanah, and Abiasaph. These are the families of the Korahites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Eleazar, Aaron’s son, married one of the daughters of Putiel, and she bore him Phinehas.
These are the heads of the fathers of the Levites according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was that Aaron and Moses to whom the Lord said, “Bring out the children of Israel from the land of Egypt according to their armies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are the ones who spoke to Pharaoh king of Egypt to bring out the children of Israel from Egypt. It was that Moses and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the day when the Lord spoke to Moses in the land of Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Lord spoke to Moses, saying, “I am the Lord. Speak to Pharaoh the king of Egypt all that I say to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, Moses said before the Lord, “Listen! I am unskilled in speech, so how will Pharaoh listen to me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord said to Moses, “See, I have made you a god to Pharaoh, and Aaron your brother will be your prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall speak all that I command you, and Aaron your brother shall tell Pharaoh to send the children of Israel out of his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will harden Pharaoh’s heart and multiply My signs and My wonders in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, Pharaoh will not listen to you, so that I may lay My hand upon Egypt and bring forth My armies and My people, the children of Israel, out of the land of Egypt by great judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Egyptians shall know that I am the Lord when I stretch forth My hand upon Egypt and bring out the children of Israel from among them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses and Aaron did it. Just as the Lord commanded them, so they did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses was eighty years old, and Aaron was eighty-three years old when they spoke to Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When Pharaoh shall speak to you, saying, ‘Show a miracle,’ then you shall say to Aaron, ‘Take your rod, and throw it before Pharaoh,’ and it shall become a serpent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses and Aaron went to Pharaoh, and they did what the Lord had commanded. And Aaron threw down his rod before Pharaoh and before his servants, and it became a serpent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh also called the wise men and the sorcerers. Then the magicians of Egypt likewise performed with their secret arts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For every man threw down his rod, and they became serpents. But Aaron’s rod swallowed up their rods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nonetheless, Pharaoh’s heart hardened so that he would not listen to them, just as the Lord had said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “Pharaoh’s heart is hardened. He refuses to let the people go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go to Pharaoh in the morning as he goes out to the water, and you shall stand by the river’s bank to meet him. You must take the rod which was turned to a serpent in your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you are to say to him, ‘The Lord, the God of the Hebrews, has sent me to you, saying, “Let My people go, so that they may serve Me in the wilderness.” But up to this point you have not listened!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord, “In this you shall know that I am the Lord: Indeed, I will strike the waters of the Nile with the rod that is in my hand, and they shall be turned to blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the fish that are in the river shall die, and the river shall stink so that the Egyptians shall be weary of drinking the river’s water.” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, “Say to Aaron, ‘Take your rod, and stretch out your hand over the waters of Egypt, over their rivers, over their canals, over their ponds, and over all their pools of water, so that they may become blood. And there will be blood throughout all the land of Egypt, both in vessels of wood, and in vessels of stone.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses and Aaron did so, just as the Lord commanded. And he lifted up the rod and struck the waters that were in the river, in the sight of Pharaoh, and in the sight of his servants, and all the waters that were in the river were turned to blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fish that were in the river died, the river stank, and the Egyptians could not drink of the water of the river. Blood was everywhere throughout the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, the magicians of Egypt did the same with their secret arts, and Pharaoh’s heart was hardened, and he did not listen to them, as the Lord had said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh turned and went into his house, and he did not concern himself with this either.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the Egyptians dug around about the river for water to drink, because they could not drink of the water of the river.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven days passed after the Lord had struck the river.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Go to Pharaoh and say to him, ‘Thus says the Lord: Let My people go, so that they may serve Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you refuse to let them go, then I will plague all your borders with frogs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the river will swarm with frogs, which shall go up and come into your house, and into your bedchamber, and on your bed, and into the houses of your servants, and on your people, and into your ovens, and into your kneading troughs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the frogs shall come upon you, upon your people, and upon all your servants.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Say to Aaron, ‘Stretch forth your hand with your rod over the streams, over the rivers, and over the ponds, and cause frogs to come up on the land of Egypt.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron stretched out his hand over the waters of Egypt, and the frogs came up, and covered the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The magicians did the same with their secret arts and brought up frogs upon the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron, and said, “Entreat the Lord, that He may take away the frogs from me, and from my people, and I will let the people go, so that they may sacrifice to the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to Pharaoh, “Glory yourself over me: When shall I entreat for you, your servants, and your people, to destroy the frogs from you and your houses, that they may remain in the river only?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he said, “Tomorrow.”
Then he said, “Be it according to your word, in order that you may know that there is no one like the Lord our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The frogs shall depart from you, and from your houses, from your servants, and from your people. They shall remain in the river only.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses and Aaron went out from Pharaoh, and Moses cried out to the Lord concerning the frogs which he had brought against Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord did according to the word of Moses. And the frogs died out of the houses, the villages, and the fields.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they gathered them together in heaps, and the land stank.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Pharaoh saw that there was relief, he hardened his heart and did not listen to them, as the Lord had said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Say to Aaron, ‘Stretch out your rod, and strike the dust of the land, so that it may become gnats throughout all the land of Egypt.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did so, for Aaron stretched out his hand with his rod and smote the dust of the earth, and it became gnats on man and on beast. All the dust of the land became gnats throughout all the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the magicians tried with their secret arts to bring forth gnats, but they could not, so there were gnats upon man and beast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the magicians said to Pharaoh, “This is the finger of God.” Nevertheless, Pharaoh’s heart was hardened, and he did not listen to them, just as the Lord had said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord said to Moses, “Rise up early in the morning and stand before Pharaoh as he comes forth to the water and say to him, ‘Thus says the Lord: Let My people go, so that they may serve Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise, if you will not let My people go, indeed I will send swarms of flies on you, and on your servants, and on your people, and into your houses. And the houses of the Egyptians shall be full of swarms of flies and also the ground wherever they are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘I will in that day set apart the land of Goshen, in which My people dwell, so that no swarms of flies shall be there, in order that you may know that I am the Lord in the midst of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will put a division between My people and your people. Tomorrow this sign will happen.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord did so, and great swarms of flies came into the house of Pharaoh, and into his servants’ houses, and into all the land of Egypt. The land was corrupted because of the swarms of flies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron, and said, “Go, sacrifice to your God in the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said, “It is not right to do so, for what we shall sacrifice to the Lord our God would be an abomination to the Egyptians. If we shall sacrifice what is an abomination of the Egyptians before their eyes, will they not stone us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We will go three days’ journey into the wilderness, and then we will sacrifice to the Lord our God, as He shall command us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh said, “I will let you go, that you may sacrifice to the Lord your God in the wilderness. Only you shall not go very far away. Make entreaty for me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said, “Indeed, I am leaving you, and I will plead with the Lord that the swarms of flies may depart from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people tomorrow. But let not Pharaoh deal deceitfully any more by not letting the people go to sacrifice to the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses went away from Pharaoh and entreated the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord did according to the word of Moses, and He removed the swarms of flies from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people. Not one remained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, Pharaoh hardened his heart at this time also, nor would he let the people go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Go to Pharaoh, and speak to him, ‘Thus says the Lord, the God of the Hebrews: Let My people go, so that they may serve Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if you refuse to let them go and continue holding them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: indeed, the hand of the Lord will be upon your livestock which are in the field, upon the horses, upon the donkeys, upon the camels, upon the oxen, and upon the sheep. There shall be a very grievous pestilence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord shall separate between the livestock of Israel and the livestock of Egypt, and nothing shall die of all that belongs to the children of Israel.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord appointed a set time, saying, “Tomorrow the Lord shall do this thing in the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord did this thing the next day, so that all the livestock of Egypt died, but not one of the livestock of the children of Israel died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh sent, and there was not one of the livestock of the children of Israel dead. And the heart of Pharaoh was hardened, so that he did not let the people go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses and to Aaron, “Take for yourselves handfuls of ashes from a kiln, and let Moses toss it toward the heavens in the sight of Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall become fine dust over all the land of Egypt and shall be a boil breaking forth with blisters upon man and beast, throughout all the land of Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took the ashes from a kiln and stood before Pharaoh. Then Moses tossed it up toward the heavens, and it became a boil breaking forth with blisters upon man and beast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The magicians could not stand before Moses because of the boils, for the boils were upon the magicians and upon all the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, the Lord hardened the heart of Pharaoh, so that he did not listen to them, just as the Lord had spoken to Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Rise up early in the morning, and stand before Pharaoh, and say to him, ‘Thus says the Lord, the God of the Hebrews: Let My people go, so that they may serve Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will at this time send all My plagues upon you and your servants and your people, so that you may know that there is none like Me in all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by now I could have stretched out My hand, so that I might strike you and your people with pestilence, and you would be cut off from the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But, indeed, for this cause I have raised you up, in order to show in you My power and so that My name may be declared throughout all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Still, you exalt yourself against My people by forbidding them to go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Certainly, tomorrow about this time I will cause it to rain a very severe hail, such as has not happened in Egypt since it was founded until now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Send therefore now and bring your livestock and all that you have in the field to safety. Every man and beast which shall be found in the field and not brought home when the hail comes down upon them will die.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that feared the word of the Lord among the servants of Pharaoh made his servants and his livestock flee into the houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that failed to regard the word of the Lord left his servants and his livestock in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord said to Moses, “Stretch forth your hand toward the heavens, so that there may be hail in all the land of Egypt, upon man and beast, and upon every herb of the field, throughout the land of Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses stretched forth his rod toward the heavens, and the Lord sent thunder and hail, and fire ran along upon the ground. So the Lord rained hail upon the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So there was hail, and fire mingled with the hail. It was so severe that there had been none like it in all the land of Egypt since it became a nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hail struck all the land of Egypt, all that was in the field, both man and beast, and the hail struck every herb of the field and broke every tree of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only in the land of Goshen, where the children of Israel were, was there no hail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh sent and called for Moses and Aaron, and said to them, “I have sinned this time. The Lord is righteous, and I and my people are wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Entreat the Lord, for there has been enough of God’s mighty thunder and hail, and I will let you go, and you shall stay no longer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to him, “As soon as I am gone out of the city, I will spread out my hands to the Lord. The thunder shall cease, and there shall no longer be any more hail, so that you may know that the earth is the Lord’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for you and your servants, I know that you will not yet fear the Lord God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the flax and the barley were struck, for the barley was in the ear, and the flax was in bud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the wheat and the spelt were not struck, for they grow up later.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses went out of the city from Pharaoh and spread out his hands to the Lord, and the thunders and hail ceased, and the rain was no longer poured upon the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, when Pharaoh saw that the rain and the hail and the thunders were ceased, he sinned yet more, and hardened his heart, he and his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heart of Pharaoh hardened, and he would not let the children of Israel go, just as the Lord had spoken by Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Go to Pharaoh, for I have hardened his heart and the heart of his servants, that I might show these signs of Mine before him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order that you may tell in the hearing of your son, and of your son’s son, what things I have done in Egypt, and My signs which I have done among them, that you may know that I am the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses and Aaron came to Pharaoh and said to him, “Thus says the Lord, the God of the Hebrews, ‘How long will you refuse to humble yourself before Me? Let My people go, that they may serve Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if you refuse to let My people go, indeed, tomorrow I will bring locusts into your territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall cover the face of the earth, such that no one will be able to see the earth. What’s more, they shall eat the remainder of that which has escaped—that which remains to you from the hail—and shall eat every tree which grows for you out of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall fill your houses, and the houses of all your servants, and the houses of all the Egyptians—which neither your fathers, nor your fathers’ fathers have seen since the day that they were on the earth until this day.’ ” And he turned and went out from Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh’s servants said to him, “How long shall this man be a snare to us? Let the men go, so that they may serve the Lord their God. Do you not yet know that Egypt is destroyed?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses and Aaron were brought back to Pharaoh, and he said to them, “Go, serve the Lord your God! But who are the ones that shall go?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said, “We will go with our young and our old, with our sons and our daughters, with our flocks and our herds will we go, for we must hold a feast to the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “The Lord indeed be with you when I let you and your little ones go. Beware, for evil is before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not so! Go now, you that are men, and serve the Lord, for that is what you desire.” Then they were driven out from Pharaoh’s presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Stretch out your hand over the land of Egypt for the locusts, so that they may come up upon the land of Egypt and eat every herb of the land, even all that the hail has left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses stretched forth his rod over the land of Egypt; then the Lord brought an east wind upon the land all that day and all that night. And when it was morning, the east wind brought the locusts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The locusts went up over all the land of Egypt and settled down in all the territory of Egypt. They were very grievous. Never before had there been such locusts as they, nor would there be such ever again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they covered the face of the whole earth, so that the land was darkened, and they ate every herb of the land, and all the fruit of the trees which the hail had left. As a result, nothing green remained there in the trees or herbs of the field, through all the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron in haste and said, “I have sinned against the Lord, your God, and against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore please forgive my sin only this once, and entreat the Lord your God, so that He may take away from me this death only.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went out from Pharaoh and prayed to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord turned a mighty strong west wind, which took away the locusts and threw them into the Red Sea. Not one locust remained in all the territory of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord hardened Pharaoh’s heart, so that he would not let the children of Israel go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Stretch out your hand toward the heavens, so that there may be darkness over the land of Egypt, a darkness which may be felt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses stretched forth his hand toward the heavens, and there was a thick darkness in all the land of Egypt for three days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did not see one another; nor did anyone rise from his place for three days. But all the children of Israel had light in their dwellings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh called to Moses and said, “Go, serve the Lord. Only let your flocks and your herds be detained. Even let your little ones also go with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses said, “You must also give us sacrifices and burnt offerings, so that we may sacrifice to the Lord our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our livestock will go with us also. Not a hoof will be left behind, for we must take of them to serve the Lord our God. And we do not know with what we must serve the Lord, until we get there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he would not let them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pharaoh said to him, “Get away from me! Watch yourself, do not see my face anymore; for in the day you see my face you shall die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said, “As you wish. I will never see your face again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord said to Moses, “I will still bring one plague more upon Pharaoh, and upon Egypt. Afterwards he will let you go from here. When he lets you go, he shall surely thrust you out from here altogether.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak now in the hearing of the people, and let every man borrow of his neighbor and every woman of her neighbor, articles of silver and articles of gold.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord gave the people favor in the sight of the Egyptians. Moreover, the man Moses was very great in the land of Egypt, in the sight of Pharaoh’s servants, and in the sight of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said, “Thus says the Lord, ‘About midnight I will go out into the midst of Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the firstborn in the land of Egypt shall die, from the firstborn of Pharaoh who sits on his throne, even to the firstborn of the maidservant that is behind the mill, as well as all the firstborn of beasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there shall be a great cry throughout all the land of Egypt, such as there has never been, nor shall ever be again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But against any of the children of Israel a dog will not even move his tongue, against man or beast, in order that you may know how that the Lord distinguishes between Egypt and Israel.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all these your servants shall come down to me and bow themselves to me, saying, ‘Get out, and all the people who follow you!’ After that I will go out.” And he went out from Pharaoh in great anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Pharaoh shall not listen to you so that My wonders may be multiplied in the land of Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses and Aaron did all these wonders before Pharaoh, and the Lord hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he would not let the children of Israel go out of his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This month shall be the beginning of months to you. It shall be the first month of the year to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak to all the congregation of Israel, saying: On the tenth day of this month every man shall take a lamb, according to the house of their fathers, a lamb for a household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if the household be too little for the lamb, let him and his neighbor next to his house take it according to the number of the persons; according to what each man shall eat, divide the lamb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your lamb shall be without blemish, a male of the first year. You shall take it out from the sheep, or from the goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall keep it up until the fourteenth day of the same month, and then the whole assembly of the congregation of Israel shall kill it in the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall take some of the blood and put it on the two side posts and on the upper doorpost of the houses in which they shall eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall eat the flesh on that night, roasted with fire, and they shall eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not eat it raw, nor boiled at all with water, but roasted with fire, its head with its legs and its entrails.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall let nothing of it remain until the morning, but that of it which remains until the morning you shall burn with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this way shall you eat it: with your waist girded, your sandals on your feet, and your staff in your hand. So you shall eat it in haste. It is the Lord’s Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will pass through the land of Egypt this night and will smite all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, both man and beast, and against all the gods of Egypt I will execute judgment. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The blood shall be to you for a sign on the houses where you are. And when I see the blood, I will pass over you, and the plague shall not be upon you to destroy you when I smite the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This day shall be a memorial to you, and you shall keep it as a feast to the Lord. Throughout your generations you shall keep it a feast by an eternal ordinance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread. On the first day you shall put away leaven out of your houses, for whoever eats leavened bread from the first day until the seventh day, that person shall be cut off from Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day there shall be a holy convocation, and on the seventh day there shall be a holy convocation for you. No manner of work shall be done on them; but that which every man must eat—that only may be prepared for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall observe the Feast of Unleavened Bread. For on this very day I brought your armies out of the land of Egypt. Therefore you shall observe this day throughout your generations as an ordinance forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month at evening, you shall eat unleavened bread until the twenty-first day of the month at evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven days shall there be no leaven found in your houses, for whoever eats that which is leavened, that person shall be cut off from the congregation of Israel, whether he be a stranger or born in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall eat nothing leavened. In all your dwellings you shall eat unleavened bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses called for all the elders of Israel and said to them, “Draw out and take for yourselves a lamb according to your families and kill the Passover lamb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take a bunch of hyssop, and dip it in the blood that is in the basin, and apply the lintel and the two side posts with the blood that is in the basin, and none of you shall go out from the door of his house until the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord will pass through to kill the Egyptians. And when He sees the blood upon the lintel and on the two side posts, the Lord will pass over the door and will not permit the destroyer to come to your houses to kill you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you shall observe this thing as an ordinance to you and to your sons forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you enter the land which the Lord will give you, according as He has promised, that you shall observe this service.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when your children shall say to you, ‘What does this service mean to you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you shall say, ‘It is the sacrifice of the Lord’s Passover, who passed over the houses of the children of Israel in Egypt, when He smote the Egyptians, and delivered our households.’ ” And the people bowed down and worshipped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the children of Israel went and did so. Just as the Lord had commanded Moses and Aaron, so they did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At midnight the Lord smote all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, from the firstborn of Pharaoh that sat on his throne to the firstborn of the captive who was in the dungeon and all the firstborn of livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh rose up in the night, he and all his servants and all the Egyptians, and there was a great cry in Egypt, for there was not a house where there was not someone dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he called for Moses and Aaron at night and said, “Rise up, and get out from among my people, both you and the children of Israel, and go, serve the Lord, as you have said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also take your flocks and your herds, as you have said, and be gone, and bless me also.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Egyptians urged the people, so that they might send them out of the land in haste, for they said, “We all will be dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people took their dough before it was leavened, with their kneading troughs being bound up in their clothes on their shoulders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the children of Israel did according to the word of Moses, and they requested of the Egyptians articles of silver and articles of gold, and clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord gave the people favor in the sight of the Egyptians, so that they gave them what they requested. Thus they plundered the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the children of Israel journeyed from Rameses to Sukkoth, about six hundred thousand men on foot, besides children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A mixed multitude also went up with them along with flocks and herds, a large amount of livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They baked unleavened cakes of the dough which they brought forth out of Egypt, for it was not leavened because they were driven out of Egypt and could not linger, nor had they prepared for themselves any food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the sojourning of the children of Israel who lived in Egypt was four hundred and thirty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at the end of the four hundred and thirty years, on the very day, all the hosts of the Lord went out from the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a night to be observed to the Lord for bringing them out from the land of Egypt. This is that night for the Lord to be observed by all the children of Israel in their generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So the Lord said to Moses and Aaron: This is the ordinance of the Passover:
No foreigner may eat of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But every man’s servant bought with money, when you have circumcised him, may eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A foreigner or a hired servant shall not eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In one house shall it be eaten. You shall not carry any of the flesh outside of the house, nor shall you break a bone of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the congregation of Israel shall keep it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when a stranger sojourns with you and keeps the Passover to the Lord, let all his males be circumcised, and then let him come near and keep it. And he shall be as one that is born in the land. However, no uncircumcised person shall eat of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The same law shall apply to him that is a native and to the stranger who sojourns among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the children of Israel did it. They did just as the Lord commanded Moses and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And that same day the Lord brought the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt by their hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sanctify unto Me all the firstborn, the firstborn of every womb among the children of Israel, both of man and of beast. It is Mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to the people, “Remember this day, in which you came out from Egypt, out of the house of bondage, for by strength of hand the Lord brought you out from this place. Nothing leavened shall be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On this day, you are going out, in the month of Aviv.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be when the Lord brings you into the land of the Canaanites and the Hittites and the Amorites and the Hivites and the Jebusites, which He swore to your fathers to give you, a land flowing with milk and honey, that you shall keep this ceremony in this month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, and on the seventh day shall be a feast to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Unleavened bread shall be eaten seven days. And there shall be no leavened bread seen among you, nor shall there be leaven seen among you in all your borders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall declare to your son on that day, saying, ‘This is done because of that which the Lord did for me when I came forth out of Egypt.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be as a sign to you on your hand and as a memorial on your forehead, in order that the Lord’s law may be in your mouth. For with a strong hand the Lord brought you out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall, therefore, keep this ordinance at its appointed time from year to year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It shall be when the Lord brings you into the land of the Canaanites, just as He swore to you and to your fathers, and shall give it you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you shall set apart to the Lord the first offspring of every womb and the first offspring of every beast which you have. The males shall be the Lord’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But every first offspring of a donkey you shall redeem with a lamb. And if you do not redeem it, then you shall break its neck, and all the firstborn of man among your sons you shall redeem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It shall be when your son asks you in time to come, saying, ‘What is this?’ that you shall say to him, ‘With a strong hand the Lord brought us out from Egypt, from the house of bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Pharaoh stubbornly refused to let us go, that the Lord killed all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, both the firstborn of man, and the firstborn of beast. Therefore, I sacrifice to the Lord the first male offspring of every womb, but all the firstborn of my sons I redeem.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be as a sign on your hand and as frontlets on your forehead, for with a strong hand the Lord brought us out of Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Pharaoh had let the people go, God did not lead them through the way of the land of the Philistines, although it was nearby. For God said, “Lest the people change their minds when they see war, and they return to Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, God led the people around, through the way of the wilderness to the Red Sea, and the children of Israel went up prepared for war out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses took the bones of Joseph with him, for he had made the children of Israel solemnly swear, saying, “God will surely attend to you, and you shall carry my bones away from here with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took their journey from Sukkoth and camped in Etham, on the edge of the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord went before them by day in a pillar of cloud to lead them along the way, and by night in a pillar of fire, to give them light, so that they might travel by day and by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did not remove the pillar of cloud by day or the pillar of fire by night from before the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak to the children of Israel, so that they turn and camp before Pi Hahiroth, between Migdol and the sea, before Baal Zephon. Opposite it you shall camp by the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Pharaoh will say of the children of Israel, “They are confused in the land. The wilderness has shut them in.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will harden Pharaoh’s heart, so that he shall pursue them. And I will be honored because of Pharaoh and because of all his army, so that the Egyptians may know that I am the Lord. And they did so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was told the king of Egypt that the people fled, the heart of Pharaoh and of his servants was turned against the people, and they said, “Why have we done this, that we have let Israel go from serving us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he made ready his chariot and took his people with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took six hundred select chariots, and all the chariots of Egypt, and officers over every one of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord hardened the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he pursued after the children of Israel. However, the children of Israel went out with confidence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Egyptians pursued after them, all the horses and chariots of Pharaoh, and his horsemen, and his army, and overtook them camping by the sea, beside Pi Hahiroth, before Baal Zephon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pharaoh drew near, the children of Israel lifted up their eyes, and indeed, the Egyptians were marching after them, and they were extremely terrified, so the children of Israel cried out to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to Moses, “Is it because there were no graves in Egypt that you have taken us away to die in the wilderness? Why have you dealt with us in this way, bringing us out of Egypt?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not this the word that we spoke to you in Egypt, saying, ‘Let us alone, that we may serve the Egyptians’? For it would have been better for us to serve the Egyptians than to die in the wilderness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses said to the people, “Fear not! Stand firm! And see the salvation of the Lord, which He will show you today. For the Egyptians whom you have seen today, you shall never see again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord shall fight for you, while you hold your peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “Why do you cry out to Me? Speak to the children of Israel, so that they go forward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as for you, lift up your rod, and stretch out your hand over the sea, and divide it; then the children of Israel shall go on dry ground through the midst of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for Me, surely, I will harden the hearts of the Egyptians, so that they shall follow them, and I will be honored through Pharaoh, through all his army, his chariots, and his horsemen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Egyptians shall know that I am the Lord when I am honored through Pharaoh, his chariots, and his horsemen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel of God, which went before the camp of Israel, moved and went behind them, and the pillar of the cloud moved before them and stood behind them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it came between the camp of the Egyptians and the camp of Israel, and there was a cloud and darkness to them, but it gave light by night. Therefore, the one did not come near the other the entire night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses stretched out his hand over the sea, and the Lord caused the sea to go back by a strong east wind all that night, and made the sea dry land, so that the waters were divided.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel went into the midst of the sea on the dry ground, and the waters were a wall unto them on their right hand, and on their left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Egyptians pursued and went in after them into the midst of the sea, even all Pharaoh’s horses, his chariots, and his horsemen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the morning watch the Lord looked down on the army of the Egyptians through the pillar of fire and of the cloud and threw the camp of the Egyptians into confusion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He removed their chariot wheels, so that they drove them with difficulty, and the Egyptians said, “Let us flee from the face of Israel, for the Lord is fighting for them against Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Stretch out your hand over the sea, so that the waters may come back upon the Egyptians, upon their chariots, and their horsemen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses stretched forth his hand over the sea, and the sea returned to its normal place when the morning appeared, while the Egyptians fled against it, so the Lord overthrew the Egyptians in the midst of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The waters returned and covered the chariots, and the horsemen, and all the host of Pharaoh that came into the sea after them. There remained not so much as one of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the children of Israel walked on dry land in the midst of the sea. And the waters were a wall to them on their right hand and on their left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus the Lord saved Israel that day from the hand of the Egyptians, and Israel saw the Egyptians dead upon the seashore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Israel saw the great power which the Lord used upon the Egyptians, the people feared the Lord, and they believed in the Lord and in His servant Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Moses and the children of Israel sang this song to the Lord and spoke, saying:
“I will sing to the Lord,
    for He has triumphed gloriously!
He has thrown the horse and his rider
    into the sea!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is my strength and song,
    and He has become my salvation.
He is my God, and I will praise Him;
    my father’s God, and I will exalt Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is a man of war;
    the Lord is His name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pharaoh’s chariots and his army
    He has thrown into the sea;
his chosen captains also
    are drowned in the Red Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The depths have covered them;
    they sank to the bottom like a stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Your right hand, O Lord,
    is glorious in power.
Your right hand, O Lord,
    shatters the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the greatness of Your excellence,
    You overthrow those who rise up against You.
You send out Your wrath;
    it consumes them like stubble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With the blast of Your nostrils
    the waters were gathered together.
The flowing waters stood upright as a heap;
    and the depths were congealed in the heart of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The enemy said,
    ‘I will pursue. I will overtake.
I will divide the spoil;
    my lust shall be satisfied upon them.
I will draw my sword,
    my hand shall destroy them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You blew with Your wind,
    and the sea covered them;
they sank like lead
    in the mighty waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Who is like You, O Lord, among the gods?
    Who is like You,
        glorious in holiness,
        fearful in praises,
        doing wonders?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You stretched out Your right hand,
    and the earth swallowed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“In Your mercy You have led
    the people whom You have redeemed;
You have guided them by Your strength
    to Your holy dwelling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The peoples have heard and are afraid;
    sorrow has taken hold on the inhabitants of Philistia.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Fear and dread fall upon them;
by the greatness of Your arm
    they are as still as a stone,
until Your people pass over, O Lord,
    until the people whom You have purchased pass over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You shall bring them in, and plant them
    on the mountain of Your inheritance,
in the place, O Lord, which You have made for Your dwelling,
    in the sanctuary, O Lord, which Your hands have established.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will reign
    forever and ever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the horses of Pharaoh went in with his chariots and with his horsemen into the sea, and the Lord brought back the waters of the sea upon them, but the children of Israel walked on dry land in the midst of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took a timbrel in her hand, and all the women went out after her with timbrels and with dancing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Miriam answered them,
“Sing to the Lord,
    for He triumphed gloriously!
The horse and his rider
    He has hurled into the sea.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses led Israel from the Red Sea, and they went out into the Wilderness of Shur, and they went three days in the wilderness and found no water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to Marah, they could not drink of the waters of Marah, for they were bitter. Therefore, the name of it was called Marah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people murmured against Moses, saying, “What shall we drink?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he cried to the Lord, and the Lord showed him a tree. When he had thrown it into the waters, the waters were made sweet.
There He made for them a statute and an ordinance, and there He tested them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “If you diligently listen to the voice of the Lord your God, and do what is right in His sight, and give ear to His commandments, and keep all His statutes, I will not afflict you with any of the diseases with which I have afflicted the Egyptians. For I am the Lord who heals you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they came to Elim, where there were twelve wells of water and seventy palm trees, and they camped there by the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they set out from Elim, and all the congregation of the children of Israel came to the Wilderness of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after their departing out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole congregation of the children of Israel murmured against Moses and Aaron in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the children of Israel said to them, “Would to God we had died by the hand of the Lord in the land of Egypt, when we sat by the pots of meat, when we ate bread to the full, for you have brought us forth into this wilderness to kill this whole assembly with hunger.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Indeed, I will rain bread from heaven for you. And the people shall go out and gather a certain amount every day, that I may test them, whether they will walk in My law or not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall come to pass that on the sixth day they shall prepare that which they bring in, and it will be twice as much as they gather daily.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses and Aaron said to all the children of Israel, “At evening, you shall know that the Lord has brought you out from the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the morning you shall see the glory of the Lord, because He hears your murmurings against the Lord. And what are we that you murmur against us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said, “This will happen when the Lord gives you meat to eat in the evening and bread in the morning to satisfy, for the Lord hears your murmurings which you murmur against Him. And what are we? Your murmurings are not against us, but against the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said to Aaron, “Say to all the congregation of the children of Israel, ‘Come near before the Lord, for He has heard your murmurings.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So as Aaron spoke to the whole congregation of the children of Israel, they looked toward the wilderness, and indeed, the glory of the Lord appeared in the cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have heard the murmurings of the children of Israel. Speak to them, saying, ‘In the evening you shall eat meat, and in the morning you shall be filled with bread. And you shall know that I am the Lord your God.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So in the evening the quail came up and covered the camp, and in the morning a layer of dew was surrounding the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the layer of dew evaporated, on the surface of the wilderness there lay a small flaky thing, as fine as the frost on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the children of Israel saw it, they said one to another, “What is it?” For they did not know what it was.
And Moses said to them, “This is the bread which the Lord has given you to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord has commanded, ‘Every man is to gather of it according to what he will eat, an omer for every man, according to the number of your people. Every man should take for them for whoever lives in his tent.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel did so, and gathered, some more, some less.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they measured it with an omer, he that gathered much had nothing left over, and he that gathered little had no lack. They gathered every man according what he could eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to them, “Let no man leave any of it until the morning.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, they did not listen to Moses, and some of them left part of it until the morning, and it bred worms, and stank, and Moses was angry with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they gathered it every morning, every man according to what he could eat. And when the sun got hot, it melted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the sixth day they gathered twice as much bread, two omers per man, and then all the leaders of the congregation came and told Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “This is what the Lord has said, ‘Tomorrow is the Sabbath, a holy Sabbath to the Lord. Bake that which you will bake today, and boil that you will boil, and all that which remains over lay up for yourselves to be kept until the morning.’ ”
