verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they laid it up until the morning, just as Moses commanded, and it did not stink, nor was there any worm in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said, “Eat it today, for today is a Sabbath to the Lord. Today you will not find it in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days you shall gather it, but on the seventh day, the Sabbath, there will be none.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened that some of the people went out on the seventh day to gather, but they found nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “How long will you refuse to keep My commandments and My instructions?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, the Lord has given you the Sabbath; therefore He gives you bread for two days on the sixth day. Every man remain in his place. Let no man go out of his place on the seventh day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people rested on the seventh day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The house of Israel named it manna, and it was like coriander seed and was white, and its taste was like wafers made with honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said, “This is what the Lord has commanded, ‘Fill an omer of it to be kept for your generations to come, so that they may see the bread that I fed you in the wilderness, when I brought you forth from the land of Egypt.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to Aaron, “Take a pot and put an omer full of manna in it, and place it before the Lord, to be kept for generations to come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the Lord commanded Moses, so Aaron placed it before the testimony, to be kept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel ate manna forty years, until they came to an inhabited land. They ate the manna until they came to the border of the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now an omer is one-tenth of an ephah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the congregation of the children of Israel journeyed from the Wilderness of Sin, from place to place, according to the commandment of the Lord, and pitched in Rephidim, but there was no water for the people to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the people contended with Moses and said, “Give us water so that we may drink.”
And Moses said to them, “Why do you contend with me? Why do you test the Lord?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the people thirsted there for water, and the people murmured against Moses, and said, “Why is it that you have brought us up out of Egypt, to kill us and our children and our livestock with thirst?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses cried out to the Lord, saying, “What shall I do to this people? They are almost ready to stone me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “Pass over before the people, and take with you some of the elders of Israel. And take in your hand your rod with which you struck the Nile, and go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, I will stand before you there on the rock in Horeb, and you shall strike the rock, and there water shall come out of it, so that the people may drink.” Then Moses did so in the sight of the elders of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called the name of the place Massah, and Meribah, because of the contending of the children of Israel, and because they tested the Lord, saying, “Is the Lord among us, or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Amalek came and fought with Israel in Rephidim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses said to Joshua, “Choose men for us and go out, fight against Amalek. Tomorrow I will stand on the top of the hill with the rod of God in my hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua did as Moses had said to him and fought against Amalek. And Moses, Aaron, and Hur went up to the top of the hill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Moses held up his hand, Israel prevailed, but when he let down his hand, Amalek prevailed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses’ hands became heavy. So they took a stone, and put it under him, and he sat on it. And Aaron and Hur supported his hands, one on one side, and the other on the other side. And his hands were steady until the going down of the sun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua laid low Amalek and his people with the edge of the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Write this as a memorial in a book and rehearse it to Joshua, for I will utterly wipe out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses built an altar and called the name of it, The Lord Is My Banner;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he said, “For the Lord has sworn that the Lord will have war with Amalek from generation to generation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jethro, the priest of Midian, Moses’ father-in-law, heard of all that God had done for Moses, and for Israel His people, and that the Lord had brought Israel out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, took Zipporah, Moses’ wife, after he had sent her back,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and her two sons, one of whom was named Gershom; for he said, “I have been a sojourner in a foreign land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the name of the other was Eliezer, for he said, “The God of my father was my help, and He delivered me from the sword of Pharaoh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, came with his sons and his wife to Moses in the wilderness, where he camped at the mountain of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to Moses, “I, your father-in-law, Jethro, am coming to you, and your wife, and her two sons with her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses went out to meet his father-in-law, and bowed down and kissed him; and they asked each other of the other’s welfare, and then they went into the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses told his father-in-law all that the Lord had done to Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for Israel’s sake, and all the hardships that had come on them along the way, and how the Lord delivered them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jethro rejoiced because of all the goodness which the Lord had done for Israel, whom He had delivered out of the hand of the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jethro said, “The Lord be blessed, who has delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of Pharaoh, who has delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I know that the Lord is greater than all gods, for in the matter in which they treated the people insolently, He was above them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, took a burnt offering and sacrifices for God, and Aaron and all the elders of Israel came to eat bread with Moses’ father-in-law before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day, Moses sat to judge the people, and the people stood around Moses from the morning until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses’ father-in-law saw all that he was doing for the people, he said, “What is this thing that you are doing for the people? Why are you sitting by yourself while all the people stand around you from morning until evening?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said to his father-in-law, “Because the people come to me to inquire of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they have a dispute, it comes to me, and I judge between a man and his neighbor, and I make known the statutes of God and His laws.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses’ father-in-law said to him, “What you are doing is not good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will surely wear yourself out, both you, and these people who are with you, for this thing is too heavy for you. You are not able to do it by yourself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now listen to me, I will advise you, and may God be with you: You be a representative for the people to God so that you may bring their disputes to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall teach them the statutes and laws and shall show them the way in which they must walk and the work that they must do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, you shall choose out of all the people capable men who fear God, men of truth, hating dishonest gain, and place these men over them, to be rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let them judge the people at all times, and let it be that every difficult matter they shall bring to you, but every small matter they shall judge, so that it will be easier for you, and they will bear the burden with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you shall do this thing and God commands you so, then you will be able to endure, and all these people also will go to their place in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses listened to his father-in-law and did everything that he had said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses chose capable men out of all Israel and made them heads over the people, rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They judged the people at all times. They brought the difficult cases to Moses, but they judged every small matter themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses sent out his father-in-law, and he went his way to his own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the third month after the children of Israel had gone forth out of the land of Egypt, on the same day they came into the Wilderness of Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they set out from Rephidim, they came to the Wilderness of Sinai and camped in the wilderness. Israel camped there before the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses went up to God, and the Lord called to him from the mountain, saying, “Thus you shall say to the house of Jacob and tell the children of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘You have seen what I did to the Egyptians, and how I lifted you up on eagles’ wings, and brought you to Myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, if you will faithfully obey My voice and keep My covenant, then you shall be My special possession out of all the nations, for all the earth is Mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will be to Me a kingdom of priests and a holy nation.’ These are the words which you shall speak to the children of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses came and called for the elders of the people and laid before them all these words which the Lord commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the people answered together and said, “All that the Lord has spoken we will do.” And Moses brought back the words of the people to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “Indeed, I am going to come to you in a thick cloud, so that the people may hear when I speak with you and always believe in you.” Then Moses told the words of the people to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “Go to the people and sanctify them today and tomorrow, and have them wash their clothes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and be ready for the third day, for on the third day the Lord will come down in the sight of all the people on Mount Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall set boundaries for the people all around, saying, ‘Take heed to yourselves so that you not go up onto the mountain or touch its border. Whoever touches the mountain will surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No hand will touch him, but he shall surely be stoned or shot through, whether it be beast or man. He shall not live.’ When the trumpet sounds a long blast, they shall come up to the mountain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses went down from the mountain to the people and sanctified the people, and they washed their clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the people, “Be ready for the third day. Do not go near your wives.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So on the third day, in the morning, there was thunder and lightning, and a thick cloud on the mountain, and the sound of an exceedingly loud trumpet. All the people who were in the camp trembled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses brought the people out of the camp to meet with God, and they stood at the foot of the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Mount Sinai was completely covered in smoke because the Lord had descended upon it in fire, and the smoke ascended like the smoke of a furnace, and the whole mountain shook violently.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the sound of the trumpet grew louder and louder, Moses spoke, and God answered him with a voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord came down on Mount Sinai, on the top of the mountain. And the Lord called Moses up to the top of the mountain, and Moses went up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Go down, warn the people, lest they force their way to the Lord to look, and many of them perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the priests also, which come near to the Lord, sanctify themselves, lest the Lord break through against them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to the Lord, “The people cannot come up to Mount Sinai, for You warned us, saying, ‘Set boundaries around the mountain, and sanctify it.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to him, “Go, get down, and come up, you and Aaron with you, but do not let the priests and the people force their way through to come up to the Lord, lest He break through against them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses went down to the people and spoke to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now God spoke all these words, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall have no other gods before Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not make for yourself any graven idol, or any likeness of anything that is in heaven above, or that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water below the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not bow down to them or serve them; for I, the Lord your God, am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children to the third and fourth generation of them who hate Me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and showing lovingkindness to thousands of them who love Me and keep My commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not take the name of the Lord your God in vain, for the Lord will not hold guiltless anyone who takes His name in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember the Sabbath day and keep it holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days you shall labor and do all your work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the seventh day is a Sabbath to the Lord your God. On it you shall not do any work, you, or your son, or your daughter, or your male servant, or your female servant, or your livestock, or your sojourner who is within your gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in six days the Lord made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that is in them, and rested on the seventh day. Therefore the Lord blessed the Sabbath day and made it holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Honor your father and your mother, that your days may be long in the land which the Lord your God is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not murder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not commit adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not steal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not covet your neighbor’s house; you shall not covet your neighbor’s wife, or his manservant, or his maidservant, or his ox, or his donkey, or anything that is your neighbor’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people witnessed the thunder and the lightning and the sound of the trumpet and the mountain smoking; and when the people saw it, they trembled and stood at a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Moses, “You speak to us, and we will listen, but do not let God speak to us, lest we die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to the people, “Do not fear, for God has come to test you, so that the fear of Him may be before you so that you do not sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people stood a distance away as Moses drew near to the thick darkness where God was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses: Thus you shall say to the children of Israel, “You yourselves have seen that I have spoken to you from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not make gods of silver alongside Me or make gods of gold for yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make an altar of earth for Me and on it you shall sacrifice your burnt offerings and your peace offerings, your sheep, and your oxen. In every place where I cause My name to be honored, I will come to you and bless you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you will make Me an altar of stone, you shall not build it of cut stones, for if you use your tool on it, you will have polluted it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall not go up by steps to My altar, so that your nakedness will not be exposed on it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the judgments which you will set before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you buy a Hebrew servant, he will serve for six years, but in the seventh he shall go out free without paying anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he came in by himself, he shall go out by himself. If he is married, then his wife will go out with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If his master gives him a wife, and she bears him sons or daughters, the wife and her children shall belong to her master, and he will go out by himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, if the servant plainly says, “I love my master, my wife, and my children. I will not go out free,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then his master will bring him to the judges, then he shall also bring him to the door or to the doorpost, and his master shall bore his ear through with an awl, and he shall serve him forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man sells his daughter to be a female servant, she shall not go out as the male servants do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If she does not please her master, who has betrothed her to himself, then he shall let her be redeemed. He has no authority to sell her to a foreign nation, because he has dealt deceitfully with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he has designated her for his son, then he shall deal with her according to the customary rights of daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he marries another wife, then he must not diminish the first one’s food, her clothing, or her marital rights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he does not provide these three for her, then she shall go out free, without paying money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that strikes a man so that he dies shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, if it was not premeditated, but God let him fall into his hand, then I will appoint you a place where he may flee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if a man willfully comes upon his neighbor in order to kill him cunningly, then you must take him from My altar, that he may die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who strikes his father or his mother shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who kidnaps a man and sells him, or if he is found in his possession, shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who curses his father or his mother shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If men fight and one strikes the other with a stone or with his fist, and he does not die, but must remain in bed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and then if he gets up and walks around on his staff, then he who struck him shall go unpunished. Only he must pay for his loss of time and shall see to it that he is thoroughly healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man strikes his male servant or his female servant with a rod so that he or she dies at his hand, then he shall surely be punished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, if he survives for a day or two, then he shall not be punished, for it is his money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If men fight and hurt a pregnant woman so that her child is born prematurely, yet there is no serious injury, then he shall be surely punished in accordance with what the woman’s husband demands of him, and he shall pay as the judges determine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if there is any serious injury, then you shall give life for life,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: burn for burn, wound for wound, bruise for bruise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man strikes the eye of his male servant or the eye of his female servant so that it is destroyed, then he must let him go free on account of his eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he knocks out his male servant’s tooth or his female servant’s tooth, then he shall let him or her go free on account of the tooth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If an ox gores a man or a woman to death, then the ox must surely be stoned and its flesh must not be eaten, but the owner of the ox will be acquitted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the ox has had the habit of goring, and the owner has been made aware of it, and he has not kept it in, and it has killed a man or a woman, then the ox shall be stoned and its owner also shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a ransom is set for him, then he shall give for the ransom of his life whatever is demanded of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whether it gored a son or gored a daughter, it will be done to him according to this rule.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the ox gores a male servant or a female servant, then its owner shall give thirty shekels of silver to their master, and the ox must be stoned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man opens a pit or if a man digs a pit and does not cover it, and an ox or a donkey falls into it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the owner of the pit must make restitution. He must give money to their owner, and the dead animal will be his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If one man’s ox hurts another’s so that it dies, then they shall sell the live ox and divide its proceeds and divide the dead ox also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if it be known that the ox has had the habit of goring and its owner has not kept it in, then he shall surely pay ox for ox and the dead animal will become his own.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man steals an ox or a sheep and kills it or sells it, then he shall repay five oxen for an ox, and four sheep for a sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a thief is caught breaking in and is struck so that he dies, then there will be no blood guilt for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If the sun has risen on him, then there is blood guilt for him.
He must make full restitution. If he has nothing, then he will be sold for his theft.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the stolen item is in fact found alive in his possession, whether it be an ox, or donkey, or sheep, then he shall repay double.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man causes a field or vineyard to be eaten and puts out his beast so that it feeds in another man’s field, he must make restitution of the best of his own field and of the best of his own vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If fire breaks out and catches in thorn bushes, so that stacked grain or the standing grain or the field are consumed, then he who started the fire must surely make restitution.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man gives his neighbor money or items to be kept for him, and it is stolen from the man’s house, if the thief is caught, he must repay double.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the thief is not caught, then the owner of the house will be brought before the judges to determine if he has laid his hand on his neighbor’s goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For any kind of trespass, whether it be for an ox, for a donkey, for a sheep, for clothing, or for any type of lost thing, where another says it is his, the case of both parties shall come before the judges. And whoever the judges find guilty will pay double to his neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man gives his neighbor a donkey, or an ox, or a sheep, or any beast to keep for him, and it dies, or is injured, or is driven away while no one sees it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then there will be an oath before the Lord between both of them that he has not laid his hand upon his neighbor’s property. And its owner must accept this, and he will not have to make restitution.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, if it was stolen from him, he shall make restitution to its owner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it is torn in pieces, then let him bring it as evidence, and he will not have to repay for that which was torn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man borrows anything from his neighbor, and it is hurt or dies when the owner was not with it, then he shall surely make restitution.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the owner was with it, he shall not make restitution. If it was a hired thing, it came with his hire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man seduces a virgin who is not engaged and has relations with her, he must surely endow her to be his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If her father absolutely refuses to give her to him, he must pay money according to the dowry of virgins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not allow a sorceress to live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever has relations with a beast must surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who sacrifices to any god other than the Lord alone shall be utterly destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must neither wrong a foreigner nor oppress him, for you were foreigners in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not afflict any widow or orphan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you afflict them in any way and they cry at all to Me, I will surely hear their cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And My anger will burn, and I will kill you with the sword, and your wives will become widows, and your children fatherless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you lend money to any of My people who is poor among you, do not be a creditor to him, and do not charge him interest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you take your neighbor’s garment as a pledge, you shall return it to him before the sun goes down,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for that is his only covering; it is his garment for his body. In what else will he sleep? And when he cries out to Me, I will hear, for I am gracious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not curse God or curse the ruler of your people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You must not delay to offer the first of your harvest and of your vats.
You must give to Me the firstborn of your sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise you must do the same with your oxen and with your sheep. Seven days it shall remain with its mother, but on the eighth day you must give it to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be holy men to Me; therefore you must not eat any flesh that is torn by beasts in the field. You must throw it to the dogs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not give a false report. Do not join your hand with the wicked to be a malicious witness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not follow the masses to do evil, and do not testify in a dispute that agrees with the crowd to pervert justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not show partiality to a poor man in his dispute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you meet your enemy’s ox or his donkey going astray, you shall surely return it to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you see the donkey of someone who hates you lying under its burden, you must not ignore it; you must surely help with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not turn justice away from your poor in his dispute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep far away from a false charge, and do not kill the innocent and the righteous, for I will not justify the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not take a bribe, for a bribe blinds those who see and subverts the words of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also you shall not oppress a foreigner, for you know the life of a foreigner, seeing you were foreigners in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall sow your land for six years and shall gather in its produce,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but in the seventh year you shall let it rest and lie fallow, so that the poor of your people may eat, and what they leave the beasts of the field may eat. You shall do likewise with your vineyard and with your olive grove.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For six days you are to do your work, but on the seventh day you must cease, so that your ox and your donkey may rest, and the son of your female servant and the foreigner may refresh themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In all things that I have said to you, watch yourselves, and do not mention the name of other gods, nor let them be heard from your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three times in the year you must celebrate a feast to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You shall observe the Feast of Unleavened Bread. For seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, as I commanded you, in the appointed time of the month Aviv, for in it you came out from Egypt.
No one shall appear before Me empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You shall observe the Feast of Harvest, the first fruits of your labors, which you have sown in the field.
You shall observe the Feast of Ingathering at the end of the year, when you have gathered in the fruit of your labors from the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three times in the year all your males shall appear before the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not offer the blood of My sacrifice with leavened bread, nor shall the fat of My sacrifice remain until the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The first of the first fruits of your land you shall bring into the house of the Lord your God.
You shall not boil a young goat in its mother’s milk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, I am going to send an angel before you to guard you along the way and to bring you into the place which I have prepared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be on guard before him and obey his voice. Do not provoke him, for he will not pardon your transgressions, for My name is in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you diligently obey his voice and do all that I say, then I will be an enemy to your enemies and an adversary to your adversaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For My angel will go before you and bring you to the Amorites, and the Hittites, and the Perizzites, and the Canaanites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, and I will completely destroy them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not bow down to their gods, or serve them, or do according to their practices, but you shall utterly overthrow them and break down their images in pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall serve the Lord your God, and He shall bless your bread and your water, and I will remove sickness from your midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one shall be miscarrying or be barren in your land. I will fulfill the number of your days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will send My fear before you, and I will throw into panic all the people to whom you shall come. I will make all your enemies turn their backs to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will send hornets before you which shall drive out the Hivite, the Canaanite, and the Hittite from before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will not drive them out before you in one year, lest the land become desolate and the beasts of the field multiply against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Little by little I will drive them out before you, until you become fruitful and inherit the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will set your boundaries from the Red Sea to the sea of the Philistines, and from the desert to the River; for I will deliver the inhabitants of the land into your hand, and you will drive them out before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not make a covenant with them or with their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall not live in your land, lest they cause you to sin against Me, for if you serve their gods, it will surely be a snare to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to Moses, “Come up to the Lord, you, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel, and you shall worship from a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses alone shall come near the Lord, but they shall not come near, nor may the people go up with him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses came and told the people all the words of the Lord and all the ordinances. Then all the people answered with one voice and said, “All the words which the Lord has said we will do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses wrote all the words of the Lord, and rose up early in the morning, and built an altar at the foot of the mountain with twelve pillars for the twelve tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent young Israelite men who offered burnt offerings and sacrificed peace offerings of young bulls to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses took half of the blood and put it in basins, and half of the blood he sprinkled on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took the Book of the Covenant and read in the hearing of the people, and they said, “All that the Lord has said we will do, and we will be obedient.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses took the blood, and sprinkled it on the people, and said, “This is the blood of the covenant, which the Lord has made with you in accordance with all these words.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses went up with Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they saw the God of Israel, and under His feet there was something like a paved work of sapphire stone as clear as the sky itself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did not lay His hand upon the nobles of the children of Israel. Also they saw God, and they ate and they drank.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “Come up to Me to the mountain and stay there, and I will give you the stone tablets with law and the commandments which I have written, so that you may teach them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses rose up with Joshua his attendant, and Moses went up to the mountain of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the elders, “Wait for us in this place until we return to you. Aaron and Hur are with you. Whoever has any matters of dispute let him come to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses went up to the mountain, and the cloud covered the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The glory of the Lord rested on Mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it for six days. And on the seventh day He called to Moses from the midst of the cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the appearance of the glory of the Lord was like a consuming fire on the top of the mountain to the eyes of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses went into the midst of the cloud and went up to the mountain. And Moses was on the mountain for forty days and forty nights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell the children of Israel to bring Me an offering. From every man who gives willingly with his heart you shall receive My offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the offering which you shall take from them: gold, silver, and bronze,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: blue, purple, scarlet, fine linen, goats’ hair,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: rams’ skins dyed red, porpoise skins, acacia wood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: oil for the light, spices for anointing oil and for fragrant incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: onyx stones, and stones to be set in the ephod and in the breastplate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let them make Me a sanctuary that I may dwell among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to all that I show you—the pattern of the tabernacle and the pattern of all its furniture—you shall make it just so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall make an ark of acacia wood two and a half cubits long, and one and a half cubits wide, and one and a half cubits high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall overlay it with pure gold, inside and out shall you overlay it, and you shall make a gold border around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall cast four gold rings for it and put them on the four feet with two rings on the one side of it and two rings on the other side of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark in order to carry the ark with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The poles must remain in the rings of the ark. They must not be removed from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put into the ark the testimony which I shall give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make a mercy seat of pure gold, two and a half cubits long and one and a half cubits wide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make two cherubim of gold, make them of hammered work at the two ends of the mercy seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make one cherub on the one end and the other cherub on the other end. From the mercy seat you shall make the cherubim on its two ends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cherubim shall stretch forth their wings upward, covering the mercy seat with their wings and facing one another. The faces of the cherubim are to face toward the mercy seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put the mercy seat above upon the ark, and in the ark you shall put the testimony that I will give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will meet with you there, and I will meet with you from above the mercy seat, from between the two cherubim which are upon the ark of the testimony. I will speak with you all that I will command you for the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall also make a table of acacia wood, two cubits long, one cubit wide, and a half cubit high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall overlay it with pure gold and make a gold border around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make a border around it of a handbreadth, and you shall make a gold molding for the frame all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make four gold rings for it and put the rings on the four corners that are on its four feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rings shall be close to the frame to provide places for the poles to carry the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make the poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold, so that the table may be carried with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make the dishes, its spoons, its pitchers, and its bowls with which to pour drink offerings. You shall make them of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall set the showbread on the table before Me always.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make a lampstand of pure gold. The lampstand and its base and its shaft are to be made of hammered metal. Its cups, its buds, and its flowers shall be of one piece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six branches shall go out from its sides, three branches of the lampstand from its one side and three branches of the lampstand from its other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three cups shall be made shaped like almond flowers with buds and blossoms on one branch, and three cups made like almond flowers in the other branch, with buds and blossoms, and the same for the six branches that come out of the lampstand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the lampstand shall be four cups shaped like almond flowers, with their buds and their blossoms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There shall be a bud under two branches of the same, and a bud under two branches of the same, and a bud under the next two branches of the same, according to the six branches that proceed out of the lampstand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their buds and their branches shall be of the same piece, all of it shall be one hammered work of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make its seven lamps, and they shall light its lamps so that they may give light to the area in front of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its snuffers and their snuff dishes shall be of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be made from a talent of pure gold along with all these utensils.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See that you make them according to their pattern which was shown to you on the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover you shall make the tabernacle with ten curtains of fine twisted linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet. Make them with cherubim, the work of a skilled workman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of each curtain shall be twenty-eight cubits, and the width of each curtain four cubits. All of the curtains shall have the same measurements.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Five curtains shall be joined together, one to another. And the other five curtains are to be joined, one to another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make loops of blue on the edge of the end curtain in one set, and likewise you shall make loops in the outermost edge of the end curtain in the second set.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make fifty loops in the one curtain, and you shall make fifty loops in the edge of the curtain that is in the second set. The loops are to be opposite to one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make fifty clasps of gold and join the curtains together with the clasps so that the tabernacle shall be one unit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make curtains of goats’ hair to be a covering upon the tabernacle. You shall make eleven curtains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of each curtain shall be thirty cubits, and the width of each curtain four cubits, and the eleven curtains shall all have the same measure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall join five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves. You shall double over the sixth curtain at the front of the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make fifty loops on the edge of the end curtain in one set and fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that joins the second set.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make fifty bronze clasps, and put the clasps into the loops, and join the tent together so that it may be one unit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The part that remains of the curtains of the tent, the half curtain that remains, shall hang over the back of the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A cubit on the one side and a cubit on the other side of that which remains in the length of the curtains of the tent shall hang over the sides of the tabernacle on this side and on that side to cover it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make a covering for the tent out of rams’ skins dyed red and a covering above of porpoise skins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make boards for the tabernacle of acacia wood, standing upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ten cubits shall be the length of each board, and a cubit and a half shall be the width of each board.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There shall be two tenons for each board, fitted to one another. You shall make all the boards of the tabernacle in this way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make the boards for the tabernacle, twenty boards for the south side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards, two sockets under one board for its two tenons and two sockets under another board for its two tenons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the second side of the tabernacle, on the north side, there shall be twenty boards,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their forty sockets of silver, two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the back of the tabernacle, to the west, you shall make six boards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make two boards for the corners of the tabernacle at the back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall be doubled together beneath and finished together at the top of it into one ring. So it shall be for both of them. They shall form the two corners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There shall be eight boards with their sockets of silver, sixteen sockets, two sockets under one board and two sockets under another board.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make bars of acacia wood, five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the side of the tabernacle for the back to the west.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The middle bar in the center of the boards shall reach from end to end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall overlay the boards with gold and make their rings of gold to provide places for the bars, and you shall overlay the bars with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall set up the tabernacle according to the plan which you have been shown on the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make a veil of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen. It shall be made with cherubim, the skillful work of a workman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall hang it on four pillars of acacia wood overlaid with gold. Their hooks also shall be of gold on four sockets of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall hang up the veil under the clasps, so that you may bring in the ark of the testimony within the veil; and the veil shall serve for you as a partition between the holy place and the Most Holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put the mercy seat on the ark of the testimony in the Most Holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall set the table outside the veil, and the lampstand opposite the table on the side of the tabernacle toward the south, and you shall put the table on the north side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make a screen for the doorway of the tent of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, the work of an embroiderer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make five pillars of acacia wood for the screen and overlay them with gold, with their hooks also made of gold, and you shall cast five sockets of bronze for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make an altar of acacia wood, five cubits long and five cubits wide. The altar shall be square, and its height shall be three cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make its horns on its four corners. Its horns shall be part of it, and you shall overlay it with bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make its pots for its ashes, and its shovels, and its basins, and its meat hooks, and its fire pans. You shall make all of its vessels out of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make a grating for it, a network of bronze, and on the net you shall make four bronze rings at its four corners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put it under the ledge of the altar beneath, so that the net will reach halfway up the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make poles for the altar, poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The poles shall be put into the rings, so that the poles shall be on the two sides of the altar when carrying it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make it hollow with boards. Just as it was shown you on the mountain, so shall they make it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make the court of the tabernacle. On the south side there shall be curtains for the court of fine twined linen one hundred cubits long for one side;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it shall have twenty pillars with twenty bronze sockets. The hooks of the pillars and their bands shall be of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise for the north side in length there shall be curtains one hundred cubits long, and its twenty pillars and their twenty sockets of bronze. The hooks of the pillars and their bands shall be of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the width of the court on the west side shall be curtains of fifty cubits with their ten pillars and their ten sockets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The width of the court on the east side shall be fifty cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The curtains on one side of the gate shall be fifteen cubits with their three pillars and their three sockets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the other side shall be curtains fifteen cubits with their three pillars and their three sockets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the gate of the court there shall be a curtain of twenty cubits, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, the work of an embroiderer, with their four pillars and their four sockets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the pillars around about the court shall be furnished with silver bands. Their hooks shall be of silver, and their sockets of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of the court shall be one hundred cubits, and the width fifty throughout, and the height five cubits of fine twisted linen, and their sockets of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the utensils of the tabernacle used in all its service, and all its tent pegs, and all the tent pegs of the court shall be of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall command the children of Israel that they bring you pure oil of olive pressed for the light, to cause the lamp to burn continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the tent of meeting, outside the veil which is before the testimony, Aaron and his sons shall arrange it from evening to morning before the Lord. It shall be a perpetual statute for the children of Israel for generations to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And bring near to yourself Aaron, your brother, and his sons with him from among the children of Israel, so that they may minister to Me as priests—Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron’s sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make holy garments for your brother Aaron, for glory and for beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall speak to all who are specially skilled, whom I have filled with the spirit of wisdom, that they may make Aaron’s garments to consecrate him, that he may minister to Me as a priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the garments which they shall make: a breastplate, and an ephod, and a robe, and an embroidered coat, a turban, and a sash. They shall make holy garments for Aaron your brother and his sons, that he may minister to Me as priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall take the gold, the blue, the purple, and the scarlet, and fine linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall make the ephod of gold, of blue, and of purple, of scarlet, and fine twined linen, the work of a skilled workman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall have the two shoulder pieces attached to its two corners, so it shall be joined together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The skillfully woven waistband of the ephod, which is on it, shall be of the same workmanship, of the same material: of gold, of blue and purple, and scarlet, and fine twisted linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take two onyx stones and engrave on them the names of the children of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: six of their names on one stone, and the other six names of the rest on the other stone, according to their birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With the work of an engraver in stone, like the engravings of a signet, you shall engrave the two stones with the names of the children of Israel. You shall set them in filigree of gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put the two stones on the shoulders of the ephod as stones of memorial for the children of Israel, and Aaron shall bear their names before the Lord on his two shoulders as a memorial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make filigree settings of gold,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and two chains of pure gold. You shall make them of twisted cord and fasten the braided chains to the filigree settings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make the breastplate of judgment, the work of a skillful workman. You shall make it in the same manner as the ephod. Of gold, of blue, and of purple, and of scarlet, and of fine twisted linen you shall make it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is to be square when doubled: a span in length and a span in width.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall set in it four rows of stones. The first row shall be a sardius, a topaz, and a carbuncle;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the second row an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the third row a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the fourth row a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper. They shall be set in gold filigree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The stones shall be according to the names of the children of Israel, twelve, according to their names, each like the engravings of a signet, every one according to his name for the twelve tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make for the breastplate braided chains of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make on the breastplate two rings of gold and shall put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put the two braided chains of gold on the two rings which are on the ends of the breastplate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall fasten the other two ends of the two braided chains in the two filigree settings and put them on the front of the shoulder pieces of the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make two rings of gold and shall put them on the two ends of the breastplate, on the edge of it which is toward the inner side of the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make two other rings of gold and shall put them on the two shoulder pieces of the ephod underneath toward the front, close to the place where it is joined above the skillfully woven waistband of the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall bind the breastplate by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a blue cord, so that it may be above the skillfully woven waistband of the ephod, and so that the breastplate will not come loose from the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron shall bear the names of the children of Israel on the breastplate of judgment over his heart when he goes into the holy place, as a memorial before the Lord continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put the Urim and the Thummim in the breastplate of judgment, and they shall be over Aaron’s heart when he goes in before the Lord. And Aaron shall bear the judgment of the children of Israel over his heart before the Lord continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make the robe of the ephod completely blue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There shall be a hole at the top of it, in the middle of it. Around its opening it shall have a binding of woven work, like the opening of a coat of mail, so that it will not be torn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make on its hem pomegranates of blue, and of purple, and of scarlet, all around its hem, and bells of gold between them all around:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate, all around on the hem of the robe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be on Aaron when he ministers. And its sound shall be heard when he goes into the holy place before the Lord, and when he comes out, so that he does not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You shall make a plate of pure gold and engrave on it, like the engravings of a signet,
HOLINESS TO THE LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put it on a blue cord, so that it may be upon the turban. It is to be on the front of the turban.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be on Aaron’s forehead, so that Aaron may bear the iniquity of the holy things which the children of Israel shall consecrate in regard to all their holy gifts. And it shall always be on his forehead, so that they may be accepted before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall embroider the tunic of fine linen, and you shall make the turban of fine linen, and you shall make the sash, the work of an embroiderer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Aaron’s sons you shall make tunics. You shall make sashes for them, and you shall make caps for them, for glory and for beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put them on Aaron your brother, and on his sons with him, and shall anoint them, and consecrate them, and sanctify them, that they may minister to Me as priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make linen undergarments for them to cover their naked skin. They shall reach from the waist to the thighs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall be on Aaron and on his sons when they come into the tent of meeting or when they come near to the altar to minister in the holy place, so that they may not bear iniquity and die.
It shall be a perpetual statute to him and his descendants after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this is the thing that you shall do to them to consecrate them, to minister as priests to Me: Take one young bull and two rams without blemish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and unleavened bread, and unleavened cakes mixed with oil, and unleavened wafers anointed with oil—you shall make them of wheat flour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put them into one basket and bring them in the basket with the bull and the two rams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall bring Aaron and his sons to the door of the tent of meeting and wash them with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take the garments and clothe Aaron with the tunic and the robe of the ephod and the ephod and the breastplate, and gird him with the skillfully woven band of the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall put the turban on his head and put the holy crown on the turban.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall you take the anointing oil and pour it on his head and anoint him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall bring his sons and put tunics on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You shall gird them with sashes, Aaron and his sons, and put the headbands on them, and the priest’s office shall be theirs for a perpetual statute.
Thus you shall consecrate Aaron and his sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall bring a bull before the tent of meeting, and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands on the head of the bull.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall kill the bull before the Lord by the door of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take of the blood of the bull, and put it on the horns of the altar with your finger, and pour all the blood beside the bottom of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take all the fat that covers the entrails, and the lobe that is above the liver, and the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, and burn them on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the flesh of the bull, its skin, and its dung, you shall burn with fire outside the camp. It is a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall also take one ram, and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands on the head of the ram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall slay the ram, and you shall take its blood and sprinkle it around on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall cut the ram in pieces, and wash its entrails and its legs, and put them with its pieces and its head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall burn the whole ram on the altar. It is a burnt offering to the Lord. It is a soothing aroma, an offering made by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall take the other ram, and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands on the head of the ram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall kill the ram and take some of its blood and put it on the tip of the right ear of Aaron, and on the tip of the right ear of his sons, and on the thumb of their right hand, and on the great toe of their right foot, and sprinkle the blood around on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take some of the blood that is on the altar and some of the anointing oil and sprinkle it on Aaron and on his garments, and on his sons, and on the garments of his sons with him. So he and his garments shall be consecrated, along with his sons and his sons’ garments with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also you shall take the fat and the rump of the ram, and the fat that covers the entrails and the lobe above the liver, and the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them and the right shoulder (for it is a ram of consecration),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one loaf of bread, and one cake of oiled bread, and one wafer out of the basket of the unleavened bread that is before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall put all of these in the hands of Aaron and in the hands of his sons, and shall wave them for a wave offering before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall take them from their hands and burn them on the altar for a burnt offering, for a soothing aroma before the Lord. It is an offering made by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take the breast of Aaron’s ram of consecration, and wave it as a wave offering before the Lord, and it shall be your portion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall consecrate the breast of the wave offering that is waved and the thigh of the priest’s portion that is contributed from the ram of the consecration, from that which was for Aaron and from that which was for his sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be for Aaron and his sons by a statute forever, for it is a contribution. It shall be a contribution from the children of Israel from their peace offerings, their contributions to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The holy garments belonging to Aaron are to belong to his sons after him, so that they may be anointed in them and be consecrated in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son that is priest in his stead shall put them on seven days when he comes into the tent of meeting to minister in the holy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take the ram of the consecration and boil its flesh in a holy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram and the bread that is in the basket by the door of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall eat those things by which the atonement was made in order to consecrate and sanctify them, but no one else shall eat them, because they are holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any of the flesh from the consecrations or from the bread remain until the morning, then you shall burn the remainder with fire. It shall not be eaten, because it is holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus shall you do to Aaron and his sons according to all that I have commanded you. You shall consecrate them for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every day you must offer a bull as a sin offering for atonement, and you must cleanse the altar when you make atonement for it. You must anoint it to consecrate it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For seven days you must make atonement for the altar and consecrate it, and then the altar will be most holy, and whatever touches the altar will be holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this is what you are to offer on the altar: two one-year-old lambs every day, continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one lamb you must offer in the morning, and the other lamb you must offer at sundown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with the first lamb will be a tenth of an ephah of flour mingled with the fourth part of a hin of beaten oil, and the fourth part of a hin of wine for a drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The other lamb you must offer at sundown and must offer with it the same grain offering and the same drink offering as in the morning, for a soothing aroma, an offering made by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This will be a continual burnt offering throughout your generations at the door of the tent of meeting before the Lord, where I will meet with you, to speak to you there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will meet there with the children of Israel, and it will be consecrated by My glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will sanctify the tent of meeting and the altar. I will also sanctify both Aaron and his sons to minister as priests to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will dwell among the children of Israel and will be their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will know that I am the Lord their God who brought them out of the land of Egypt, so that I may dwell among them. I am the Lord their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, you must make an altar for burning incense. You must make it of acacia wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It must be a cubit in length, and its width a cubit. It will be square. Its height will be two cubits; the horns shall be of one piece with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must overlay it with pure gold, its top, its sides all around, and its horns; and you must make a molding of gold all around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must make two golden rings for it under its molding. You must make them on its two sides, on opposite sides of it, and they will be holders for the poles with which to carry it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you must make the poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must put it before the veil that is by the ark of the testimony, in front of the mercy seat that is over the testimony, where I will meet with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron must burn sweet incense on it. Every morning, when he trims the lamps, he must burn incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Aaron lights the lamps at sundown, he must burn incense on it. It is to be a perpetual incense before the Lord throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must offer no strange incense on it, nor burnt sacrifice, nor grain offering, and you must not pour out a drink offering on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron must make atonement on its horns once a year with the blood of the sin offering of atonement. Once a year he must make atonement on it throughout your generations. It is most holy to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you take the census of the children of Israel according to their number, then each man is to pay a ransom for his life to the Lord when you count them, so that there be no plague among them when you number them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what everyone who is counted must give: half a shekel according to the shekel of the sanctuary (a shekel is twenty gerahs). The half shekel will be the offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who is counted, from twenty years old and above, must give an offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rich must not give more and the poor must not give less than half a shekel when they give the offering to the Lord, to make atonement for your lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must take the atonement money of the children of Israel and give it for the service of the tent of meeting, so that it may be a memorial to the children of Israel before the Lord, to make atonement for your lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must also make a basin of bronze, with its base also of bronze, for washing, and you must put it between the tent of meeting and the altar, and you must put water in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Aaron and his sons must wash their hands and their feet from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they go into the tent of meeting, or when they come near the altar to minister by burning incense as an offering made by fire to the Lord, they must wash with water so that they will not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they must wash their hands and their feet, so that they will not die. And it will be a perpetual statute for them, even to him and to his seed throughout their generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take for yourself choice spices: five hundred shekels of pure myrrh, half as much sweet-smelling cinnamon (two hundred and fifty shekels), two hundred and fifty shekels of sweet-smelling cane,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: five hundred shekels of cassia, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, and a hin of olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you must make with it a holy anointing oil, a perfumed compound, the work of a perfumer. It will be a holy anointing oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you must anoint the tent of meeting with it, along with the ark of the testimony,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the table and all its utensils, and the lampstand and its utensils, and the altar of incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the altar of burnt offering with all its utensils, and the basin and its stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must consecrate them, so that they may be most holy. Whatever touches them must be holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must anoint Aaron and his sons and consecrate them, so that they may minister as priests to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must speak to the children of Israel, saying, “This will be a holy anointing oil to Me throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It must not be poured out on anyone’s body, nor shall you make any other like it in composition. It is holy, and it will be holy to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever makes anything like it or whoever puts any of it on a layman will be cut off from his people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses: Take for yourself sweet spices, stacte and onycha and galbanum, sweet spices with pure frankincense of equal amounts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make of these an incense, a compound expertly blended, mingled with salt, pure and holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must beat some of it very fine and put part of it before the testimony in the tent of meeting where I will meet with you. It will be most holy to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the perfume which you will make, you may not make it for yourselves using the same recipe. It must be holy for the Lord to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever makes anything like it in order to use it as perfume must be cut off from his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, I have called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have filled him with the Spirit of God in wisdom, in understanding, in knowledge, and in all manner of craftsmanship
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to devise artistic works for work with gold, with silver, and with bronze,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in the cutting of stones for settings, and in carving of wood, to work in all manner of craftsmanship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, indeed, I have given him Oholiab, the son of Ahisamak, of the tribe of Dan, and I have given skill to all who are specially skilled, that they may make everything that I have commanded you:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the tent of meeting, the ark of the testimony, and the mercy seat that is on it, and all the furniture of the tent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the table and its utensils, and the pure lampstand with all its utensils, and the altar of incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the altar of burnt offering with all its utensils, and the basin and its stand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the woven garments, the holy garments for Aaron the priest and the garments of his sons, to minister as priests,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the anointing oil and sweet incense for the holy place. They must make them according to all that I have commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak also to the children of Israel, saying, “You must surely keep My Sabbaths, for it is a sign between Me and you throughout your generations, that you may know that I am the Lord who sanctifies you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall keep the Sabbath, for it is holy to you. Everyone who defiles it will surely be put to death. For whoever does any work on it, that person will be cut off from among his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days may work be done, but on the seventh is the Sabbath of complete rest, holy to the Lord. Whoever does any work on the Sabbath day will surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the children of Israel must keep the Sabbath, to observe the Sabbath throughout their generations, for a perpetual covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a sign between Me and the children of Israel forever, for in six days the Lord made heaven and earth, but on the seventh day He rested and was refreshed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had made an end of communing with him on Mount Sinai, He gave Moses the two tablets of testimony, tablets of stone, written with the finger of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the people saw that Moses delayed coming down from the mountain, the people gathered themselves together around Aaron and said to him, “Come, make us gods which will go before us. As for this Moses, the man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we do not know what has become of him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron said to them, “Break off the gold earrings that are in the ears of your wives, your sons, and your daughters, and bring them to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the people broke off the gold earrings that were in their ears and brought them to Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He received them from their hand, and fashioned it with an engraving tool, and made it into a molded calf. Then they said, “This is your god, O Israel, who brought you up from the land of Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
